description: Explore data scientist and analyst roles, required skills, industry demand, and career growth opportunities

slides.title: Data Science Career Paths
slides.content:
# Data Science Career Paths ğŸš€

Navigate your journey in the data world!

## What you'll learn:
- **Data Scientist Roles** - What DS professionals do
- **Data Analyst Roles** - Analytics career track
- **Skills Required** - Technical and soft skills
- **Industry Demand** - Job market insights
- **Career Growth** - Advancement paths

> ğŸ’¡ **Exciting Time:** Data Science has been the #1 job in America for years!

## Career Landscape

| Role | Avg Salary (US) | Growth Rate |
|------|-----------------|-------------|
| Data Scientist | $120K-150K | 36% |
| Data Analyst | $70K-95K | 25% |
| ML Engineer | $130K-170K | 40% |
| Data Engineer | $110K-140K | 30% |

## The Opportunity
- ğŸ“ˆ Demand exceeds supply
- ğŸŒ Remote-friendly roles
- ğŸ’¼ Industry-agnostic skills
- ğŸ”„ Multiple career paths

slides.title: Data Scientist Roles
slides.content:
# Data Scientist Roles ğŸ§¬

The core role in data science teams.

## Day-to-Day Activities
- Building predictive models
- Exploratory data analysis
- Communicating insights
- Collaborating with stakeholders

## Role Variations

### Entry Level (0-2 years)
- Focus on execution
- Learn domain and tools
- Support senior team members

### Mid Level (2-5 years)
- Own end-to-end projects
- Mentor juniors
- Specialize in areas

### Senior Level (5+ years)
- Technical leadership
- Architecture decisions
- Cross-team influence

## Specializations

| Specialization | Focus Area |
|----------------|------------|
| NLP Scientist | Text and language |
| Computer Vision | Images and video |
| ML Engineer | Production systems |
| Research Scientist | Novel algorithms |
| Applied Scientist | Business problems |

## Typical Path
```
Junior DS â†’ DS â†’ Senior DS â†’ Lead/Staff DS â†’ Principal DS
                           â†“
                    Manager â†’ Director â†’ VP/CDO
```

slides.title: Data Analyst Roles
slides.content:
# Data Analyst Roles ğŸ“Š

The bridge between data and business decisions.

## Core Responsibilities
- Creating reports and dashboards
- SQL queries and data extraction
- Statistical analysis
- Business insights
- Stakeholder presentations

## Analyst Variations

| Role | Focus | Tools |
|------|-------|-------|
| Business Analyst | Process improvement | Excel, SQL |
| Product Analyst | User behavior | Amplitude, SQL |
| Marketing Analyst | Campaign performance | GA, Tableau |
| Financial Analyst | Financial data | Excel, Python |
| Operations Analyst | Efficiency | SQL, BI tools |

## Career Progression

```
Jr Analyst â†’ Analyst â†’ Sr Analyst â†’ Lead Analyst
                              â†“
                    Analytics Manager â†’ Director
                              â†“
                    Data Scientist (transition)
```

## Analyst vs Data Scientist

| Aspect | Analyst | Data Scientist |
|--------|---------|----------------|
| Focus | Reporting | Prediction |
| Tools | SQL, Excel, BI | Python, ML |
| Output | Dashboards | Models |
| Skills | Business-heavy | Technical-heavy |

slides.title: Role Check
slides.quizQuestion: Which role primarily focuses on building production ML systems?

slides.title: Technical Skills Required
slides.content:
# Technical Skills ğŸ’»

Must-have technical competencies.

## Programming

### Python (Essential)
```python
# Core libraries
import pandas as pd      # Data manipulation
import numpy as np       # Numerical computing
import sklearn           # Machine learning
import matplotlib.pyplot # Visualization
```

### SQL (Essential)
```sql
-- Must know queries
SELECT customer, SUM(sales)
FROM orders
WHERE date >= '2024-01-01'
GROUP BY customer
HAVING SUM(sales) > 1000
ORDER BY 2 DESC;
```

## Data Skills Matrix

| Skill | Analyst | Scientist | Engineer |
|-------|---------|-----------|----------|
| SQL | â­â­â­â­â­ | â­â­â­â­ | â­â­â­â­â­ |
| Python | â­â­â­ | â­â­â­â­â­ | â­â­â­â­â­ |
| Statistics | â­â­â­ | â­â­â­â­â­ | â­â­â­ |
| ML | â­â­ | â­â­â­â­â­ | â­â­â­â­ |
| Cloud | â­â­ | â­â­â­ | â­â­â­â­â­ |

## Learning Priority
1. SQL fundamentals
2. Python basics
3. Statistics
4. Data visualization
5. Machine learning

slides.title: Soft Skills Required
slides.content:
# Soft Skills ğŸ¤

Often the differentiator for career success!

## Communication

### For Technical Audiences
- Clear methodology explanations
- Technical documentation
- Code reviews

### For Business Audiences
- Storytelling with data
- Executive summaries
- Actionable recommendations

## Problem Solving
- Breaking down complex problems
- Creative solution finding
- Systematic debugging

## Business Acumen
- Understanding industry context
- Connecting data to value
- Prioritizing high-impact work

## Collaboration

| Stakeholder | How to Work With |
|-------------|------------------|
| Engineers | Technical specs, code reviews |
| Product | Requirements, tradeoffs |
| Executives | Summaries, ROI |
| Domain Experts | Context, validation |

## Growth Mindset
- Continuous learning
- Embracing feedback
- Comfort with ambiguity

> ğŸ’¡ **Pro Tip:** The best data scientists are those who can explain complex findings simply!

slides.title: Career Growth Paths
slides.content:
# Career Growth ğŸ“ˆ

Mapping your journey to success.

## Individual Contributor Track

```
Junior (0-2 yrs)
    â†“
Mid-Level (2-5 yrs)
    â†“
Senior (5-8 yrs)
    â†“
Staff/Principal (8+ yrs)
    â†“
Distinguished/Fellow
```

## Management Track

```
Senior DS
    â†“
Team Lead
    â†“
Manager
    â†“
Director
    â†“
VP / CDO
```

## Hybrid Paths

| From | To | Common Transition |
|------|----|-------------------|
| Analyst | Data Scientist | Learn ML |
| DS | ML Engineer | Focus on production |
| DS | Product Manager | Business focus |
| DS | Consultant | Client-facing |

## Level Expectations

| Level | Scope | Leadership |
|-------|-------|------------|
| Junior | Tasks | Self |
| Mid | Projects | Self |
| Senior | Team impact | Informal |
| Staff | Org impact | Technical |
| Principal | Company impact | Strategic |

slides.title: Building Your Career
slides.content:
# Building Your Career ğŸ—ï¸

Practical steps for success.

## Portfolio Development

### Must-Have Projects
1. **EDA project** - Showcase analysis skills
2. **ML project** - End-to-end pipeline
3. **Dashboard** - Visualization expertise
4. **Domain project** - Industry knowledge

## Online Presence

- **GitHub** - Clean, documented repos
- **LinkedIn** - Professional network
- **Blog/Medium** - Thought leadership
- **Kaggle** - Competitions and learning

## Resume Tips

```markdown
## Project Entry Format
[Project Name]
- Impact: Increased X by Y%
- Methods: Used [techniques]
- Tools: Python, SQL, [specific tools]
- Outcome: [measurable result]
```

## Interview Prep

| Round | Focus | Prep |
|-------|-------|------|
| Technical Screen | SQL, Python | LeetCode |
| Take-home | End-to-end DS | Past projects |
| Onsite | System design, ML | Mock interviews |
| Behavioral | Culture fit | STAR method |

> ğŸ’¡ **Tip:** Quality > Quantity for portfolio projects!

slides.title: Continuous Learning
slides.content:
# Continuous Learning ğŸ“š

Stay relevant in a fast-changing field.

## Learning Resources

### Courses
- **Coursera** - University courses
- **DataCamp** - Interactive learning
- **Fast.ai** - Practical deep learning
- **Kaggle Learn** - Free micro-courses

### Books
- "Python for Data Analysis" - McKinney
- "Hands-On Machine Learning" - GÃ©ron
- "The Elements of Statistical Learning" - ESL
- "Designing Data-Intensive Apps" - Kleppmann

### Communities
- Reddit: r/datascience, r/MachineLearning
- LinkedIn groups
- Local meetups
- Slack communities

## Staying Current

| Resource | Frequency | Purpose |
|----------|-----------|----------|
| Papers | Weekly | Research trends |
| Blogs | Weekly | Industry practice |
| Conferences | Yearly | Networking, trends |
| Online courses | Quarterly | Skill building |

## Learning Path Template

```markdown
Q1: [Specific skill/topic]
Q2: [Next skill]
Q3: [Project applying skills]
Q4: [Advanced topic or specialization]
```
